verses.verse: Then Deborah <S%H1683><s%> and Barak <S%H1301><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Abinoam <S%H42><s%> sang <S%H7891><s%> on that day, <S%H3117><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>
"That the leaders <S%H6546><s%> led <S%H9460><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%> That the people <S%H5971><s%> volunteered, <S%H5068><s%> Bless <S%H1288><s%> the Lord! <S%H3068><s%>

"Hear, <S%H8085><s%> O kings; <S%H4428><s%> give <S%H238><s%> ear, <S%H238><s%> O rulers! <S%H7336><s%> I – to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> I will sing, <S%H7891><s%> I will sing <S%H2167><s%> praise <S%H2167><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

"Lord, <S%H3068><s%> when Thou didst go <S%H3318><s%> out from Seir, <S%H8165><s%> When Thou didst march <S%H6805><s%> from the field <S%H7704><s%> of Edom, <S%H9000><s%> The earth <S%H776><s%> quaked, <S%H7493><s%> the heavens <S%H8064><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> dripped, <S%H5197><s%> Even <S%H1571><s%> the clouds <S%H5645><s%> dripped <S%H5197><s%> water. <S%H4325><s%>

"The mountains <S%H2022><s%> quaked <S%H5140><s%> at the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> Sinai, <S%H5514><s%> at the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

"In the days <S%H3117><s%> of Shamgar <S%H8044><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Anath, <S%H6067><s%> In the days <S%H3117><s%> of Jael, <S%H3278><s%> the highways <S%H734><s%> were deserted, <S%H2308><s%> And travelers <S%H1980><s%> <S%H9350><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> by roundabout <S%H6128><s%> ways. <S%H734><s%>

"The peasantry <S%H6520><s%> ceased, <S%H2308><s%> they ceased <S%H2308><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%> Until <S%H5704><s%> I, Deborah, <S%H1683><s%> arose, <S%H6965><s%> Until I arose, <S%H6965><s%> a mother <S%H517><s%> in Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

"New <S%H2319><s%> gods <S%H430><s%> were chosen; <S%H977><s%> Then <S%H227><s%> war <S%H3901><s%> [was] in the gates. <S%H8179><s%> Not a shield <S%H4043><s%> or a spear <S%H7420><s%> was seen <S%H7200><s%> Among forty <S%H705><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> in Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
"My heart <S%H3820><s%> [goes out] to the commanders <S%H2710><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> The volunteers <S%H5068><s%> among the people; <S%H5971><s%> Bless <S%H1288><s%> the Lord! <S%H3068><s%>

"You who ride <S%H7392><s%> on white <S%H6715><s%> donkeys, <S%H860><s%> You who sit <S%H3427><s%> on [rich] carpets, <S%H4055><s%> And you who travel <S%H1980><s%> on the road <S%H1870><s%> – sing! <S%H7878><s%>

"At the sound <S%H6963><s%> of those who divide <S%H9160><s%> [flocks] among <S%H996><s%> the watering <S%H4857><s%> places, <S%H4857><s%> There <S%H8033><s%> they shall recount <S%H8567><s%> the righteous <S%H6666><s%> deeds <S%H6666><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> The righteous <S%H6666><s%> deeds <S%H6666><s%> for His peasantry <S%H6520><s%> in Israel. <S%H3478><s%> Then <S%H227><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the gates. <S%H8179><s%>

"Awake, <S%H5782><s%> awake, <S%H5782><s%> Deborah; <S%H1683><s%> Awake, <S%H5782><s%> awake, <S%H5782><s%> sing <S%H1696><s%> a song! <S%H7892><s%> Arise, <S%H6965><s%> Barak, <S%H1301><s%> and take <S%H7617><s%> away your captives, <S%H7628><s%> O son <S%H1121><s%> of Abinoam. <S%H42><s%>

"Then <S%H227><s%> survivors <S%H8300><s%> came <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the nobles; <S%H117><s%> The people <S%H5971><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to me as warriors. <S%H1368><s%>

"From Ephraim <S%H669><s%> those whose root <S%H8328><s%> is in Amalek <S%H6002><s%> [came <S%H3381><s%> down, <S%H3381><s%>] Following <S%H310><s%> you, Benjamin, <S%H1144><s%> with your peoples; <S%H9415><s%> From Machir <S%H4353><s%> commanders <S%H2710><s%> came down, And from Zebulun <S%H2074><s%> those who wield <S%H4900><s%> the staff <S%H7626><s%> of office. <S%H9373><s%>

"And the princes <S%H8269><s%> of Issachar <S%H3485><s%> [were] with Deborah; <S%H1683><s%> As [was] Issachar, <S%H3485><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> [was] Barak; <S%H1301><s%> Into the valley <S%H6010><s%> they rushed <S%H7971><s%> at his heels; <S%H7272><s%> Among the divisions <S%H6390><s%> of Reuben <S%H7205><s%> [There were] great <S%H1419><s%> resolves <S%H2706><s%> of heart. <S%H3820><s%>

"Why <S%H4100><s%> did you sit <S%H3427><s%> among <S%H996><s%> the sheepfolds, <S%H4942><s%> To hear <S%H8085><s%> the piping <S%H8292><s%> for the flocks <S%H5739><s%>? Among the divisions <S%H6390><s%> of Reuben <S%H7205><s%> [There were] great <S%H1419><s%> searchings <S%H2714><s%> of heart. <S%H3820><s%>

"Gilead <S%H1568><s%> remained <S%H7931><s%> across <S%H5676><s%> the Jordan; <S%H3383><s%> And why <S%H4100><s%> did Dan <S%H1835><s%> stay <S%H1481><s%> in ships <S%H591><s%>? Asher <S%H836><s%> sat <S%H3427><s%> at the seashore, <S%H3220><s%> <S%H2348><s%> And remained <S%H7931><s%> by its landings. <S%H4664><s%>

"Zebulun <S%H2074><s%> [was] a people <S%H5971><s%> who despised <S%H2778><s%> their lives <S%H5315><s%> [even] to death, <S%H4191><s%> And Naphtali <S%H5321><s%> also, on the high <S%H4791><s%> places <S%H4791><s%> of the field. <S%H7704><s%>

"The kings <S%H4428><s%> came <S%H935><s%> [and] fought; <S%H3898><s%> Then <S%H227><s%> fought <S%H3898><s%> the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%> At Taanach <S%H8590><s%> near <S%H5921><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> of Megiddo; <S%H4023><s%> They took <S%H3947><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> plunder <S%H1215><s%> in silver. <S%H3701><s%>
"The stars <S%H3556><s%> fought <S%H3898><s%> from heaven, <S%H8064><s%> From their courses <S%H4546><s%> they fought <S%H3898><s%> against <S%H5973><s%> Sisera. <S%H5516><s%>

"The torrent <S%H5158><s%> of Kishon <S%H7028><s%> swept <S%H1640><s%> them away, <S%H1640><s%> The ancient <S%H6917><s%> torrent, <S%H5158><s%> the torrent <S%H5158><s%> Kishon. <S%H7028><s%> O my soul, <S%H5315><s%> march <S%H1869><s%> on with strength. <S%H5797><s%>
"Then <S%H227><s%> the horses' hoofs <S%H6119><s%> beat <S%H1986><s%> From the dashing, <S%H1726><s%> the dashing <S%H1726><s%> of his valiant <S%H47><s%> steeds. <S%H47><s%>

'Curse <S%H779><s%> Meroz, <S%H4789><s%>' said <S%H559><s%> the angel <S%H4397><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> 'Utterly <S%H779><s%> curse <S%H779><s%> its inhabitants; <S%H3427><s%> Because <S%H3588><s%> they did not come <S%H935><s%> to the help <S%H5833><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> To the help <S%H5833><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> against the warriors. <S%H1368><s%>'

"Most blessed <S%H1288><s%> of women <S%H802><s%> is Jael, <S%H3278><s%> The wife <S%H802><s%> of Heber <S%H2268><s%> the Kenite; <S%H7017><s%> Most blessed <S%H1288><s%> is she of women <S%H802><s%> in the tent. <S%H168><s%>

"He asked <S%H7592><s%> for water <S%H4325><s%> [and] she gave <S%H5414><s%> him milk; <S%H2461><s%> In a magnificent <S%H117><s%> bowl <S%H5602><s%> she brought <S%H7126><s%> him curds. <S%H2529><s%>

"She reached <S%H7971><s%> out her hand <S%H3027><s%> for the tent <S%H3489><s%> peg, <S%H3489><s%> And her right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> for the workmen's hammer. <S%H1989><s%> Then she struck <S%H1986><s%> Sisera, <S%H5516><s%> she smashed <S%H4277><s%> his head; <S%H7218><s%> And she shattered <S%H4272><s%> and pierced <S%H2498><s%> his temple. <S%H7541><s%>

"Between <S%H996><s%> her feet <S%H7272><s%> he bowed, <S%H3766><s%> he fell, <S%H5307><s%> he lay; <S%H7901><s%> Between <S%H996><s%> her feet <S%H7272><s%> he bowed, <S%H3766><s%> he fell; <S%H5307><s%> Where <S%H834><s%> he bowed, <S%H3766><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> he fell <S%H5307><s%> dead. <S%H7703><s%>

"Out of the window <S%H2474><s%> she looked <S%H8259><s%> and lamented, <S%H2980><s%> The mother <S%H517><s%> of Sisera <S%H5516><s%> through <S%H1157><s%> the lattice, <S%H822><s%> 'Why <S%H4069><s%> does his chariot <S%H7393><s%> delay <S%H309><s%> in coming <S%H935><s%>? Why <S%H4069><s%> do the hoofbeats <S%H6471><s%> of his chariots <S%H4818><s%> tarry <S%H309><s%>?'
"Her wise <S%H2450><s%> princesses <S%H8282><s%> would answer <S%H6030><s%> her, Indeed <S%H637><s%> she repeats <S%H7725><s%> her words <S%H561><s%> to herself,

'Are they not finding, <S%H4672><s%> are they not dividing <S%H2505><s%> the spoil <S%H7998><s%>? A maiden, <S%H7358><s%> two maidens <S%H7358><s%> for every <S%H7218><s%> warrior; <S%H1397><s%> To Sisera <S%H5516><s%> a spoil <S%H7998><s%> of dyed <S%H6648><s%> work, <S%H6648><s%> A spoil <S%H7998><s%> of dyed <S%H6648><s%> work <S%H6648><s%> embroidered, <S%H7553><s%> Dyed <S%H6648><s%> work <S%H6648><s%> of double embroidery <S%H7553><s%> on the neck <S%H6677><s%> of the spoiler <S%H7998><s%>?'

"Thus <S%H3651><s%> let all <S%H3605><s%> Thine enemies <S%H340><s%> perish, O Lord; <S%H6><s%> But let those who love <S%H3068><s%> Him be like the rising <S%H157><s%> of the sun <S%H3318><s%> in its might. <S%H8121><s%>" And the land <S%H1369><s%> was undisturbed <S%H776><s%> for forty <S%H8252><s%> years. <S%H705><s%>
